title: Removed Icons
text:
These are icons that have been removed, usually due to deprecation.

Name: Acclaim

Pearson Launch (2014): Pearson created Acclaim as an enterprise-class badging platform based on the Mozilla Open Badges standard. It was designed to provide a “verifiable, data-rich” way to share academic and professional achievements online.
Credly Merger: In 2018, Credly (another major digital credential provider) acquired the Acclaim platform from Pearson. For several years, the service was rebranded as “Acclaim by Credly.”
Full Integration: Today, the Acclaim platform has been fully integrated into the Credly brand.

title: Requested Icons
text: These are icons that have been requested.

title: Requested Icons
text:
Additional Work Required

Name: OSF Preregistered+

Organization: 
Website: 
Description:
Notes: https://osf.io/tvyxz/ All the icons are in an EPS file at https://osf.io/5fghy, including some Preregistered+ variants such as Preregistered+ TC. However, Preregistered+ alone is not in the EPS file. Bitmaps are available at https://osf.io/t5nuj and https://osf.io/2qcpx.

https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/221


Name: medRxiv

Organization: 
Website: medRxiv
Description: Preprint server (sister service to bioRxiv) for health sciences.
Notes: No SVG found, might need to convert

https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/224


Name: EndNote

Organization: Clarivate
Website: EndNote Homepage
Description: EndNote is a paid citation manager from Clarivate.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/250

No SVG found, might need to convert



Name: Credly

Organization: 
Website: Credly Acclaim
Description:
Notes: Need to find the SVG

Name: VDE

Organization: 
Website: VDE
Description: VDE ist the German equivalent to IEEE which is already in the database. VDE is active in science, standards, and testing. Many (electrical) engineering standards are issued by VDE, as well as whitepapers on emerging technologies.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/210

Name: Huggingface

Organization: 
Website: Huggingface.co
Description: Massive repository for AI models, including hosted ML spaces. A pro icon in the fontawesome library is similar, but not the same.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/209

Name: IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society (APS)

Organization: 
Website: https://ieeeaps.org/
Description: APS is an academic society like its parent IEEE and publishes papers, makes conferences and you can join it as a member.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/207

Name: GND

Organization: 
Website: https://gnd.network/
Description: The Integrated Authority File (GND) is a service facilitating the collaborative use and administration of authority data. These authority data represent and describe entities, i.e. persons, corporate bodies, conferences and events, geographic entities, topics and works relating to cultural and academic collections. Libraries in particular use the GND to catalogue publications. However, archives, museums, cultural and academic institutions, and researchers involved in research projects are also increasingly working with the GND. Authority data make cataloguing easier, offer definitive search entries and forge links between different information resources.

Every entity in the GND features a unique and stable identifier (GND ID). This makes it possible to link the authority data with both each other and external data sets and web resources. This results in a cross-organisational, machine-readable data network.
More information about the GND at https://gnd.network
(above information from: https://www.dnb.de/EN/Professionell/Standardisierung/GND/gnd_node.html)

Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/204

Name: GrabCAD

Organization: 
Website: https://grabcad.com/
Description: GrabCAD is a leading file sharing platform for engineers. It open sourcing of cad files and encourages cooperation. Over this side engineers can display their work and skills. The side also has an inbuilt freelancing system.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/203

Name: Bookbub

Organization: 
Website: https://bookbub.com/
Description: Bookhub is a platform that helps authors promote their books. Certainly not relevant for all academics, but it could be for those who are (frequently) writing books for non-academics. It offers authors the possibility to make a public profile, e.g. https://www.bookbub.com/profile/debbie-macomber?list=author_books.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/199

Name: zbMATH (AKA Zentralblatt)

Organization: 
Website: https://zbmath.org/
Description: Second most popular math publications database.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/197

Name: DataCamp

Organization: 
Website: https://www.datacamp.com/
Description: DataCamp provides professional credentials for technical skills, and it’d be nice to have this icon available for resumes and the like since FontAwesome currently doesn’t support it.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/195

Name: Canvas (Instructure)

Organization: 
Website: 
Description: Canvas is a commonly used LMS and the icon would be useful for course websites.
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/194

The branding guide originally listed is now gone, will require more searching


Name: Quarto

Organization: Posit
Website: Quarto
Description: Quarto is an open-source scientific and technical publishing system.

Name: Readcube

Organization: 
Website: https://www.readcube.com/
Description: This is the website Springer and Wiley use to allow free sharing of research papers
Notes: https://github.com/jpswalsh/academicons/issues/189

title: Scholaricons
text:
Academicons is a specialist icon font for academics. It contains icons for websites and organisations related to academia that are often missing from mainstream font packages. It can be used by itself, but its primary purpose is to be used as a supplementary package alongside a larger icon set.
All product names, logos, and brands are the property of their respective owners. Use of these names, logos, and brands does not imply endorsement.

title: Scholaricons
text:
Academicons is a specialist icon font for academics. It contains icons for websites and organisations related to academia that are often missing from mainstream font packages. It can be used by itself, but its primary purpose is to be used as a supplementary package alongside a larger icon set.
All product names, logos, and brands are the property of their respective owners. Use of these names, logos, and brands does not imply endorsement.

title: Scholaricons
Scholaricons
text:
With font building apps
TODO: The academicons.svg font file can be readily imported into most font building apps, allowing you to merge only the icons that you want into your personalised icon set.

title: Scholaricons
text:
Desktop publishing
The font files can be installed locally on your system, allowing access to the icons through most publishing software.

title: Scholaricons
text:
Scientific publishing (TODO)
TODO: You can access the full set of icons in LaTeX using the Academicons package.
You can also use the font in documents produced with Quarto using the Quarto Scholaricons extension.

title: Scholaricons
text:
Requesting new icons
New icons can be requested by creating an issue. Before submitting a request, please check that the following conditions are satisfied:

The logo/icon requested is of appropriate dimensions (roughly square).

If that doesn’t exist, then there’s really not much that can be done, and the request will have to be ignored until such time that a (squarish) logo/icon can be provided.

An icon of appropriate resolution can be provided or linked to.

The provided file must be a vector file (e.g. SVG, EPS, AI) or a PDF with the vector file embedded.
These files are all very easy to work with, and result in the most faithful reproductions of the icon.
I don’t have time to convert high resolution raster images (e.g. JPEG, PNG, GIF), so any requests that aren’t in a vector format will be closed.

The icon can be reduced to monochrome.

This is one of the basic requirements of a versatile icon, but it is often overlooked when icons are made by people who are not professional designers. Academia is full of unprofessional designers, and it is sometimes the case that a logo relies entirely on the use of different colours.
In certain cases we can be creative (see the dblp logo), but more often than not it will be impossible to create a monochrome version of the icon. Feel free to make the request, but it will probably be ignored if an alternate logo cannot be found.
